## Functions

### emitComments() {#a0e50dc982f01eab3eeb5eef624e25f03}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void emitComments (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmdisasmcontext">LLVMDisasmContext</a> &#42; DC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatted-raw-ostream">formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; FormattedOS)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Emits the comments that are stored in <code>DC</code> comment stream.

Each comment in the comment stream must end with a newline.

<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVMDisasmInstruction() disassembles a single instruction using the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// disassembler context specified in the parameter DC.  The bytes of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction are specified in the parameter Bytes, and contains at least</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BytesSize number of bytes.  The instruction is at the address specified by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the PC parameter.  If a valid instruction can be disassembled its string is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// returned indirectly in OutString which whos size is specified in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parameter OutStringSize.  This function returns the number of bytes in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction or zero if there was no valid instruction.  If this function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// returns zero the caller will have to pick how many bytes they want to step</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// over by printing a .byte, .long etc. to continue.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191" lineLink="/docs/api/groups/llvmcdisassembler/#ga4ab4dad1fdcb9e651fa60f6059ab09b4"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcdisassembler/#ga4ab4dad1fdcb9e651fa60f6059ab09b4">LLVMDisasmInstruction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcdisassembler/#gae903996143e88ff186c738f81122094e">LLVMDisasmContextRef</a> DCR, uint8&#95;t &#42;Bytes,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             uint64&#95;t BytesSize, uint64&#95;t PC, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;OutString,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OutStringSize)&#123;</span></CodeLine>
